page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: THIS AREA OF SCOTLAND LIES APPROX.16 KM.TO THE S. OF EDINBURGH,CAPITAL CITY OF SCOTLAND.{IT}IS MAINLY RURAL AND CONSISTS OF FARM LAND AND WOODLAND THROUGH WHICH MEANDERS THE RIVER NORTH NORTH ESK.THE ESTATE OF THE CLERK FAMILY AND THE SOUTHERN CORNER OF PENICUIK TOWN ARE ALSO ENCOMPASSED BY THE BOUNDARY OF THIS BLOCK.{THE VARIETY OF LAND COVER ENSURES THE ATTRACTIVENESS OF THIS AREA SET AGAINST A BACKDROP FORMED BY THE SURROUNDING PENTLAND HILLS.{NOTABLE LANDMARKS IN THE AREA ARE PENICUIK HOUSE,RAMSAY'S MONUMENT AND BRUNSTANE CASTLE.{THESE}PROVIDE VALUABLE HISTORICAL EVIDENCE OF LIFE IN THE PAST JUST AS THE MODERN SUPERMARKET BUILDING AND RETIREMENT HOME WILL IN THE FUTURE.{THE}LOCAL PEOPLE OF PENICUIK ENJOY A GREAT VARIETY OF VOCATIONAL AND SPORTING ACTIVITIES.
